info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 12:31PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams within the N Second Creek watershed from Mount Ulla to Woodleaf. * WHERE...Portions of western Rowan County, North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, parks, boat-access areas, golf courses, low-water crossings, and low-lying roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1222 PM EDT, High flows continue on N Second Creek and will continue through the day today following several rounds of heavy rainfall since Monday night. Areas of the upper watershed have received 4-7 inches of rainfall since Monday. The following streamgauge is above Action/Advisory Stage, resulting in nuisance flooding along North Second Creek... ID: BRBN7 NAME: above Statesville Blvd (US 70), 4 mi S of Woodleaf CURRENT STAGE: 12.61 feet TREND: Rising Slowly ACTION/ADVISORY STAGE: 12.00 feet MINOR FLOOD STAGE: 14.00 feet ESTIMATED FORECAST: N Second Creek will continue to rise slowly through this afternoon before cresting below 13 feet later today. However, additional heavy rainfall may cause N Second Creek to start rising again and more significant flooding cannot be ruled out, especially on Thursday. IMPACTS: At 12 feet, N Second Creek is out of its banks up and downstream of the gauge site on US 70, flooding adjacent farmland and other low-lying areas. In fast-response situations, upstream tributaries will likely already be flooding several low-water crossings. Impacted crossings upstream may include at White Rd, Lyerly Rd, Upright Rd, Graham Rd, Hall Rd, Childers Rd, and Bear Poplar Rd. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mooresville, Mount Ulla, and Woodleaf.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
